VerilogWriter Document

Brief Introduction

If you have IJulia locally, execute

In[1]
using VerilogWriter

and then

In[2]
x = @always (
    dout = d1 + d2;
    if b1
        dout = ~d1
    elseif b2 
        dout = ~d2
    end
)
vshow(x)

and now you get the following:

Out[2]
always_comb begin
    dout = (d1 + d2);
    if (b1) begin
        dout = ~d1;
    end else if (b2) begin
        dout = ~d2;
    end
end
type: VerilogWriter.Alwayscontent

Another example is

In[3]
x = @always (
    @posedge clk;
    
    dlog <= dout;
    if b1 
        dout <= ~dout 
    end
) 
vshow(x)
[ralways](@ref)

and now you get

Out[3]
always_ff @( posedge clk ) begin
    dlog <= dout;
    if (b1) begin
        dout <= ~dout;
    end
end
type: VerilogWriter.Alwayscontent
VerilogWriter.ralways — Function
ralways(expr::Expr)

Convert Julia AST to Verilog always-block. Dispatch methods here according to expr.head.

source
ralways(expr, ::T) where {T <: Val}

The case where expr.head is not block, which means expr is one assign (inside always-block) or if-else block.

source
ralways(expr, ::Val{:block})

Convert multiple ifelse-blocks and assigns to one always-block.
